website_summaries.verdict: Although not as sophisticated as some others, this is a high-quality pedometer at a mid-range price.
cons: Some durability concerns about connector clip

customer_reviews.title: Nice pedometer
customer_reviews.text: I used to use this all the time. Couldn't really compare it with another product, but it seemed to read it just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Ada Wong

customer_reviews.title: Oldie but Goodie - works!
customer_reviews.text: I paid $16 for it in Jan. 2008. It was in a drawer and I bought a fancier one later, which I dug out and have been trying to set (won't work). So I replaced the battery on this one and worked right away, set it in 15 seconds. It is larger than the new one but it works. Just goes to show, why quit making something that works? Now people are paying $50 and $75 for a used one. My friend bought a $350 Apple watch to count her steps and I said I have my $16 Omron in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Do Your 10,000 Steps a Day!  Count them!
customer_reviews.text: Great Pedometer 1. I stick this in my pocket and walk. 2. Accurately counts steps 3. Affordable It's good to count your steps! Try and hit 10,000 steps a day. Stay healthy! forever, Annie Annie Lanzillotto author of "L is for Lion: an italian bronx butch freedom memoir" SUNY Press and "Schistsong" BORDIGHERA Press www.annielanzillotto.com
customer_reviews.author: Annie Lanzillotto author of L is for Lion

customer_reviews.title: Over ten years, and still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: My Omron HJ-112 is 10 1/2 years old and still works great -- I just need to change the battery every 6 months. I very much like the fact that when I drive fifty miles, it doesn't record 2000 steps (because of the bumps on the road). I've consider getting a fancier pedometer, and I own a fitbit, but I still use the Omron because of it's reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy L. Hazuka

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This was a great little pedometer. Had it for five years. It was very accurate. Wanted to buy another one just like it but the price has really skyrocketed. It is three times the price of other pedometers. I don’t think it is worth that much. Got the other model Omron has out. The Alvina HJ325. I don’t like that model. It only measures in tenths of a mile not hundredths. And the case is always falling part. Will look for other pedometers now.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great Step Counter - Really Bad Belt Clip!
customer_reviews.text: I love this step counter; purchased on 4/09/2014. Lost it 3 times; 3rd times the charm 7/18/2014. The first time it popped off my waistband into the toilet. Yuck! It survived, I rinsed it off and yeh! still working! Next time it popped off unbeknownst to me when I released my seatbelt. My entire family checked their front & back yards, driveways & front house parking area. I checked everywhere including my car, etc. Hours later I rechecked car and found it stuck between seat & center council. I have retraced all steps today & checked &rechecked the car 3 times. Great step counter, lousy belt clip.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Reader

customer_reviews.title: Good Fitbit alternative for older adults
customer_reviews.text: Good for older adults that might not be able to handle the tech side of Fitbits or like devices. Fairly simple to operate and accuracy is good enough for most.
customer_reviews.author: skullmann

customer_reviews.title: Works great; I just wish it had an off button
customer_reviews.text: Just two relatively small complaints; first, I actually had to buy this item twice because I lost the first one after it fell of my belt during one of my walks. So after I received the second one I made sure to install the included lanyard, which I loop through a belt loop to make sure I don't lose it again. So far so good. The only other issue is that it doesn't have an off button and it doesn't shut itself off so it uses up those little watch batteries way faster than it should. If someone has figured out a way to shut it off please reply. I'd appreciate the tip.
customer_reviews.author: TLWebster

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Accurate and easy to use. I keep buying this product in one form over and over. I've had to buy it more than once because after so many years of day in and day out use, it just seems to stop lighting up. (Even with fresh batteries). I think I've owned 2 of the ones that record online and 2 of these that are little simpler product. But, iv'e been using them for more than 10 years i think. If not maybe I should be more concerned that I've had to buy 4 of them...
customer_reviews.author: ACB3344

customer_reviews.title: Love this gizmo ! 5 Stars !
customer_reviews.text: Although I use a really great android GPS app called Runkeeper, I purchased this pedometer as an adjunct for counting the steps and comparing the distance logged with that of the app. I walk a couple of miles briskly every morning and intended to use it strictly for that. As it turns out I keep it with me all of the time to keep a record of how many steps I walk throughout the day/night. I've had this for a few weeks and so far it is working flawlessly. This is the only device of this type I've tried so I cannot compare it to others, but I give this one my highest recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Tat - Ace

customer_reviews.title: Accurate but the clip is worthless and falling resets the pedometer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pedometer after reading all the reviews. It is fairly accurate and does a good job counting real steps. For example, it doesn't advance when I am in the car. It automatically resets itself for the next day. The downside to this pedometer is that it isn't robust. The clip that comes with it is lousy. When I bend and move, the clip works its way off my belt and invariably falls to the ground. Almost every time the pedometer falls, it resets itself and wipes out my step count.
customer_reviews.author: scmom

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This pedometer works just fine for me. I bought it to replace another Omron which I had used for years, but lost in the depths of an airplane seat. I wear it all the time to count my steps. I am not interested in monitoring anything else.
customer_reviews.author: choirlady50

customer_reviews.title: Poor accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit based on the good reviews here, however, I have found its accuracy to be inconsistent. I tried using it in my pants pocket and it was wildly innacurate, more or less doubling my step count. On my belt or waist band it was better depending on where I placed it, i.e. front back or side, but it would still add extra steps no matter where it was. One caveat to this review, I'm recvovering from a stroke and my gait is unsteady, so this might be part/all of the problem, but I thought these electronic sensor types where supposed to be better than the old mechanical pendulum type. Well, not in my case.
customer_reviews.author: Anon 7

customer_reviews.title: The price is right.  It's accurate.  It's not complicated.
customer_reviews.text: This may seem like your basic pedometer but it turns out to be the best one I've used, by far! I've gotten some of the fancy-schmancy varieties that claim to do everything up to and including cooking a gluten free meal. It turns out they are so complicated that I give up trying to push the right buttons or use my "smart-stuff" to download their data. The Omron counts your steps - accurately. It tells you the time and you can see a history of your steps by date. It resets itself each night so you start off fresh each morning. The price is right. It's accurate. It's not complicated.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Barbara

customer_reviews.title: I love the accuracy of these pedometers but they fall off ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing pedometers for years. I love the accuracy of these pedometers but they fall off way too easily. I would wear it on my front or back pocket depending on what I was doing and it would fall of at least five times a day. I had one for just over a year and it died and I assuming it is because of how many times it crashed to the floor. I bought a second because I do love the product but lost it while walking. I ended up replacing it with a FitBit because I know that won't fall off. Excellent pedometer but the company needs to work on the clip.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Very good...
customer_reviews.text: I don't really like giving out 5 STARS. Very accurate, IMHO. I've owned three different ones that you could buy at Sprost Auhtortiy (Sportsline brand?), and they were terrible. You stand up and you get 5 steps counted. Very inaccurate. But this one, there's no contest...if you want an accurate step counter, you will not go wrong with this one. Keep in mind, if you just walk a few steps and stop, it will not count those (is that exercise anyways? I think not..heh heh)...but if you walk for about 8-10+, then you get credit for those steps...heh heh... Has other features I have not really used yet, so no comment on those.
customer_reviews.author: vickun

customer_reviews.title: Still works great after several years use
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this a couple of years ago, and am finally getting around to writing some product reviews. Like I said, I've been using this very model for several years, and it still works great. It's easy to program and it's very accurate. I've had to replace the battery twice, and that's easy to do too.
customer_reviews.author: dspeck

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: At first glance you might think this is just a regular pedometer with some added features but it's ability to count your steps even in your pocket is wonderful. I bought one for me and my dad and he doesn't like to clip things to his pants or belt but being able to put it in his pocket to help him monitor his health after his stroke has been a true blessing. Plus this little pedometer can stand up to some wear and tear. My kids washed mine when doing laundry, luckily did not put it in the dryer, and it still works perfectly. Best pedometer I have owned so far. Would purchase another one!
customer_reviews.author: Annette Hanes

customer_reviews.title: Best things, worst thing
customer_reviews.text: Best things: - It will track whether it's in your pocket, purse or clipped to your belt, unlike pedometers with a pedulum that must be vertical. - It's accurate, at least far more so than nearly all other brands. Bad thing: - It tracks only time that it deems to be "aerobic," not total time. So if your goal is to walk 30 minutes, you'd better be speed walking or keeping up a pretty fast pace every minute or you need a different way to track that. Pretty weak not to have that very common feature. If you're out of shape, slower paces might still be aerobic for you, but this gizmo doesn't "think" that way.
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: replacement to an older HJ-112
customer_reviews.text: The four stars is not because of the product. I have owned a couple of these before. The reason I bought a new one... The belt/holder broke (not the first time) The company helped me out the first time, but this time the design had been changed. So the old one still works, but no easy way to put it in the right place for accuracy! Note, These are NOT very accurate in a pocket or on their side. I decided to just buy a new one because they are not very expensive, & the pedometer itself is very reliable. They just need a stronger mounting clip/breacket!
customer_reviews.author: D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great Pedometer!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pedometer. It's accurate but sometimes it stops counting then catches up with itself. This pedometer has shown me how inactive I am! While I am sorry for the person who wrote that they loved theirs until they lost it because it fell out of the holder, I thank you for including that in your review. I attached mine to the tether, then to my waistband, and clipped the pedometer onto my waistband as well. My pedometer has fallen out of the holder for or 5 times in the 5 days I've had it! Fortunately, it was tethered. If you buy this pedometer & want to keep it, please use the tether!
customer_reviews.author: Troy & Leilani

customer_reviews.title: Omron HJ-112 Digital Pocket Pedometer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for my husband and myself and we really like them!! Omron dual axis technology; counts steps accurately and quietly whether positioned vertically or horizontally. Automatically resets daily to accurately track steps. Stores up to 7 days of information in memory; Resets to zero at midnight. Six tracking modes, track steps, aerobic steps, time, distance, calories and fat grams burned. Tracks two kinds of steps; Tracks both regular and brisk steps separately. They are very accurate and you can place it just about anywhere on you and it will track your steps perfectly!!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Motivation from your pocket
customer_reviews.text: Pros I bought this for my spouse and it helped him visualize the concept of a day's exercise more clearly. He has trimmed off a significant amount of weight from his waistline. He can snack at night and not feel guilty! Cons Could MAYBE consider that the delayed counting of steps (12 at a time, I believe) to be a bit annoying, but it is nonetheless accurate and has proven results so we don't care. We haven't used any other pedometers, and can not compare. This was a GREAT first pedometer experience!
customer_reviews.author: M. gungor

customer_reviews.title: so close to perfection
customer_reviews.text: The pedometer is far and away the nicest one I've experienced. I also thought the mounting system would work better than others I've tried. Alas, the relatively short clip has a tendency to disengage from my belt, and only the lanyard has saved it. I'm overweight and that extra me hanging over my belt no doubt complicates the clip's job of securely latching onto the belt. Just a bit more length and perhaps a lip on the end of the clip, as used by my cell phone, would have made a big difference. I hope that and a stealthier lanyard will be considered in the next product improvement cycle. Otherwise, a great pedometer with all the right stuff.
customer_reviews.author: RTfact

customer_reviews.title: Best Pedometer, don't bother with the others
customer_reviews.text: I've used other pedometers, and this one is by far the best. Not only does it track total steps and aerobic steps separately, it also calculates mileage and calorie loss. It's important to calibrate it properly by determining and setting your stride. I even walked into a pool with it on accidentally (duh) and it was submerged for probably a minute before I figured it out. It never stopped working. You can tuck it in a pocket or a handbag, or clip it to a belt. It's a bit bulky, that's my only complaint. It would be nicer if it had a flatter profile. But a superb product and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as accurate as I would like
customer_reviews.text: I bought myself one of these and have not had any problems with it, so when I heard that my brother wanted a pedometer for Christmas, I ordered this same one for him. However, it doesn't seem to be as accurate as I would like. As a test, to show my husband that it worked, I took 10 steps. It registered 24 steps. It makes me wonder how often it counts too many or misses some. I have had mine for awhile, and just replaced the battery last week, so it is not a low battery issue.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for almost 2 months now. The accuracy is incredible for the price. Have not had any problems wearing it all day. Does not increment while driving in the car as some have complained about and I drive a little bouncy hatchback. It does not increase the steps while sitting or swiveling in my chair at work either. One big bonus for me... it accurately counts my steps while on my Epic elliptical trainer. This is nice as I do not have to remember to add these in at the end of the day. I clip it on my belt in the morning and forget about it for the rest of the day!
customer_reviews.author: S Cyrus

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Have owned many pedometers in the past; this is the best one. Most significantly, it's accurate -- doesn't drop steps, doesn't add steps. Robust -- still working fine after about 3 months. In the past, others have gone wacky after 2-3 weeks. Nice feature set -- especially the 1 week memory. Shortcomings: Not a biggie, but claim is that you can just place this in your pocket or purse and it will continue to count properly. In my experience, this is an overstatement. If the device is not reasonably vertical in your pocket/purse, device will miscount steps. Positioned on your waist as most such devices recommend, works great.
customer_reviews.author: LennyH

customer_reviews.title: Omron Pedometer Review
customer_reviews.text: The pedometer is very accurate if one plans only to walk and stay walking. It only picks up after 4 seconds of movement, so start and stop motion(as in shopping, or other everyday activity) will not register as steps taken. I have another (different) pedometer that does register movement, and I find myself wearing the Omron only when I plan walking, or doing my aerobic routine. Recently, it has not been kicking in until well after the 10 minutes of aerobic pace( maybe the battery is wearing down). It is a nicely designed unit; the holder and the lanyard are wonderful( I have lost pedometers because they lack securing devices). The memory feature is nice to keep track of history.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Gavit

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT PEDOMETER
customer_reviews.text: After much shopping and review reading, I gave my best friend this pedometer for her birthday. She told me she was going to try to start walking more to get more exercise, so counting steps seemed a good idea. Together we read the instructions -- very easy to follow -- and were amazed that it said an average number of steps a day could be over 12,000. After her first day of just slipping it into her pocket and taking her Omron wherever she went, she called to say she'd walked over 10,000 steps. Surprise! She loves this pedometer. I did good in the gift-giving department. Now I am going to have to buy an identical one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: PD Budd

customer_reviews.title: PRICE!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had and liked this pedometer (gone through 2 on them) over the past 6 or 7 years. But the price was under $25. What's up? Saw a comment that they gave them out for free to get good reviews. Not my experience. Not paying $70+ no matter how much I liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Olivares

customer_reviews.title: instant gratification!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Omron HJ112 about 4 weeks into my walking routine, having been recommended by my walking partner, who owns one. It is easy to program, and the only thing I had to learn from the instruction manual was how to determine my stride. I've found it to be pretty accurate..my 6.2 mile walk ( according to the car odometer) actually steps out to between 6.2 and 6.5 depending on my stride(as compared to what I've entered it as) and how fast I walk it. I LOVE the instant gratification of seeing over 12,000 steps in a workout, and the calories burned definitely gives you feel good points. It gives you accountability and I've recommended it to several friends.
customer_reviews.author: budget minded Momma

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and Extras
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing pedometers for almost two years now, and this is the best one I've used so far. It is a little larger than some, but well worth any awkwardness. Seems accurate (I often wear more than one pedometer to check against each other), love that it automatically resets each day, keeps a memory, keeps a separate tally of aerobic steps/time. One thing I didn't think I would necessarily use but have found invaluable is the CLOCK ... as I rarely wear a watch. Doesn't accidentally reset easily (has happened once) and the safety clip prevents a fall (has happened a couple of times). Definitely would recommend, in fact I'm buying a couple as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: *BlackhamBunch*

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pedometer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried $5-10 pedometers before and they were terribly inaccurate d/t shuffling of waistbands, like when using the restroom, or jumping in and out of vehicles--extra steps counted but not taken. I can shake this pedometer and jump around in one place and it will not count the movements as steps--thank goodness! I am an RN and work a variety of shifts and wanted to know which shifts I was the most active on and keep track of how busy I am each shift and this little guy helps keep track and accurately calculate that. I love it and believe it is definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: KatieJ

customer_reviews.title: The little pedometer that could
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with an adult toy -- the Omron pedometer. It is so easy to use that even a mechanically challenged adult can press the appropriate buttons. I take separate walks with each of two dogs, and I am always adding two blocks here and half a mile there in order to reach those magic 10,000 steps. It fits snugly in my pocket, and I switch back and forth between miles -- so far today a bit less than two miles -- and steps -- 5,5665. Oh well, I do have to sit at my computer for several hours today, and I can rest on my 19,000 steps last Friday. Did I mention that I'm having fun?
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Pedometer fantastic
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived on time, and was fairly easy to set up if you followed the directions. All the parts needed were there (even the battery) so I was able to use it immediately. The price was very good for all the information you get from this little machine, and the best part of all is that I can leave it my purse when shopping and even know how many steps I have taken while in the mall. I was not real impressed with the little extra carrying strap, but the attachment clip fastened to it is very good and the other is not needed. I found it to be accurate and a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: catlady

customer_reviews.title: Unit great but clip terrible
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 5 of these units. 3 for myself and two as gifts. Why three for myself you ask.....well I have lost 2 of them due to the lousy belt clip. If you just carry it in your pocket the step count is totally inaccurate. I think it flips around too much causing the high numbers. (I counted 15 steps and the unit registered 35.) When clipped on my belt its spot on accurate. If it wasn't for the inadequate belt clip I would have rated it a 5 star. I'm going to try using Velcro patches this time.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Nelson

customer_reviews.title: KKLJ
customer_reviews.text: The pedometer works well and captures accurate information. It's a bit bulky, at least 1.25" from clip to front. The only reason for 3 of 5 stars is because it's not very rugged. Be sure not to drop it! I accidently dropped mine on a tile floor. It landed on the clip side (not the face of the pedometer). Since then the hundred digit no longer displays the entire digit. There's so little of it showing, I'm having to guess at the number. The pedometer seems well-built and not flimsly at all, but one drop and it's not functioning properly.
customer_reviews.author: KKLJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Inexpensive Pedometer
customer_reviews.text: This Omron pedometer is well reviewed and highly rated on Amazon and other sites. It lives up to its billing. For the money spent and the features it advertises, it delivers. I have used it for walking and for running. I recalibrate when I switch between running and walking to be certain I'm getting accurate readings and it appears to work fine. Distance and time are the two main features I wanted in a pedometer. The much more expensive heart rate monitor combination devices were more than I needed for data and much more money than I wanted to spend. Give this one a try!
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Best Pedometer I've ever had!
customer_reviews.text: I've had probably a dozen pedometers. I've lost half of them -- they pop off my belt. Some have the reset button positioned so that when I bend over, I lose my steps. Some quit working after a couple weeks. Some are so sensitive I get double steps. THIS pedometer does none of those -- it works great. It's easy to use. It's accurate, and the litle clip attachment keeps it from popping off my belt. I bought one for myself and after using it for a couple of weeks, I bought one for my husband. The only thing this pedometer doesn't have that I wish it did is a stopwatch. But I'd buy it again (and did!).
customer_reviews.author: Island reader

customer_reviews.title: The only one most people will need
customer_reviews.text: I believe I made a rating the first time I ordered one of these. I liked it so much I ordered one for hubby and one for one of my sons. The reason I came back to update is...by mistake I just put this pedometer thru a regular load of wash. I found it when I was transferring that load to the dryer. It still had a display, but it was telling me the battery was dead. I opened the case and took the battery out. Allowed the unit to dry and inserted a fresh battery. It is working just fine. I am amazed! Another reason to love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Flo

customer_reviews.title: Takes a licking - keeps on ticking!
customer_reviews.text: OK - I'm sure Omron does NOT endorse this sort of stuff - but last week, while launching a boat, the motor stopped and I was forced to jump into the lake in my clothes....forgetting that my beloved Omron pedometer was in my pocket!! ACK! By the time I remembered it, the screen was partially filled with water and of course it didn't work.... But I took the battery out, shook out as much water as possible - and let it dry for several days. Then put the battery back in....and it WORKS!!!! I'm stunned!! But really happy because if I had to buy another pedometer - I'd have purchased THIS model again!
customer_reviews.author: D. Masselink

customer_reviews.title: I am just surprised it works so well!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to measure our walks around the routes that we take. It was priced right. I did a bunch of research, and we tried it. IF you follow the directions, which we did... We set the stride length etc. and went out for a walk. Then, we looped the same area as close as we could in our car. It was over 6 miles and the difference between the odometer on the car and the pedometer was less than 1⁄4 mile. Which could easily be because we can't drive on the outside loops on the sidewalks. So, it's probably much closer. VERY IMPRESSED!
customer_reviews.author: Impulse Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy but don't forget it
customer_reviews.text: This pedometer was easy to program and does what it says it does. It counts my steps. I don't use it to count miles walked though it does provide that as well. The only problem was at first remembering to clip it on my jeans pocket each morning but now it's super easy to put on and take off. The clip holds nicely and I am able to judge how active I've been each day and strategize how best to improve my step count. I haven't lost weight yet, but I do feel better and keep energy longer since I've started being more active.
customer_reviews.author: T.D.R.

customer_reviews.title: Very Good but sizeable
customer_reviews.text: I am new to the pedometer world. My prior experience was one of those McDonald's "happy meal"-type freebies. I did my homework and found that this unit provides a comprehensive set of measures. I am still in the fine tuning stage of stride length as I am using it primarily for aerobic exercise walking. I have played around with it to count steps per day. However, as the title of this review aludes... it is a bit large in size for daily wear. None-the-less, I am quite pleased with its features and the fact that it counts both total steps and aerobic steps. This is great for me when I go out on my "healthy power walks."
customer_reviews.author: P. M. OConnor

customer_reviews.title: sad, i can't use it
customer_reviews.text: some come with a screwdriver and battery from what the reviews I've read...well mine didn't. For now it's just sitting in my wall locker until i get back stateside...BX doesn't carry this size battery, and it's to late for me to order battery and small screw driver...if you order this don't be surprised if you have to buy a battery too.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth $$$
customer_reviews.text: I've been very pleased with this pedometer. I had a cheaper one and this one beats it hands down! This was recommended to me by a friend and she loves hers also. Was a little skeptical spending more $$ on this one, but it was well worth it. Love all the features! Clip doesn't always stay on the greatest, but I use the safety strap w/it and haven't dropped it yet - would probably have lost it though had I not used the strap. Good motivation! Seems to be very accurate (not perfect, but way better than I had before - almost right on the dot)! Ended up buying one for my daughter and mother too! (They love theirs too!)
customer_reviews.author: cherokeecat

customer_reviews.title: great pedometer!
customer_reviews.text: this is a really good pedometer for price and abilities but i wish it told me the duration of how long i walked all day. but other than that it is great. sometimes it falls off by belt because I am always on the go but thats why it comes with a tight safety clip for backup. definitely wear the safety clip or you will lose it. when it knocks off it just hangs down like 4 inches. i highly suggest this product. it does everything it says it does.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for a month or so. Easy for even a grandma to set up and has worked fine ever since, even tho I accidentally submerged it in water one time, quickly pulling it out and drying it. It keeps me motivated to walk more and has been a good aid in my weight loss program.
customer_reviews.author: God lover

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little pedometer if you don't mind putting the calculations into the gadget. Was pretty straight forward instructions on how to do this. Works great clipped on or in a pocket, which is great when you are wearing pockets. I compared it to the same thing HJ-150 which I also have. It gave me 600 less steps in 10,000 steps a day, so thinking it's a touch more accurate than the 150. I love both of them. You can't go wrong with either one! If you have pockets all the time or carry a purse, etc. Get the HJ-112, if you don't usually have pockets get the HJ-150!
customer_reviews.author: B.Renz

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy to use and wear device for accountability with exercise
customer_reviews.text: Recently, my sister and I got together and she was wearing a Omron pedometer to keep track of her daily exercise activities. She has lost over 40 lbs and attributes much of her success to this little device. She walks at least 11,000 steps/day either with exercise, walking or running "in place" to achieve this goal. It's small and light and easily clips on to slacks, shorts, skirts and even hooks on your underwear if you wear a dress. It's easy to use, automatically returns to "0" at midnight and makes you accountable to yourself! I love it and already see a difference with results in my own exercise routine.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Genet

customer_reviews.title: accurate but missing something
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the accuracy of this pedometer: I was using a lower-quality model for my daily activities which was reporting a 10-15% higher step total due to inadvertant bumps, etc. However, this model does not allow you to reset the count to zero, which is a serious deficiency. If you have the pedometer in your gym bag, and then once you get to the gym you want to measure the distance you walk, you can't reset the count to zero, you will have to subtract whatever the start count is from the end count to find out how far you traveled.
customer_reviews.author: S. Saurers

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I tried several pedometers and each was a bit lacking. I've now had this one since August 2011(review written 4/2013) and it's still working great. Be sure to input your stride distance and it is very accurate, the 7 day history feature is very helpful. I don't use the kcal or steps, just the mileage. Be warned, though, if you don't use the small plastic clip and cord and attach it to your clothing (pants/shorts for me) you will lose it. The large clip that holds the unit itself will come unclipped several times a week.
customer_reviews.author: shops for wife

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I needed to track the number of my steps, period. I don't even care how far I walk. I just have to count off my steps. This pedometer lets me do that. It would probably let me do a gazillion other things too, but I'm too old to figure them out. The analog pedometer I bought first, broke almost immediately. This one hangs nicely from a clip, and has a safety clip backup. I've never dropped it. It resets itself overnight, yet remembers each day's steps for a while. Just a very nice product that does what I wanted it to at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Works AOK
customer_reviews.text: Especially like the clip/strap that keeps it from falling on the floor or pavement. I haven't used all the fancy features and may never, but it does a good job of counting my steps which is what I want. Resets to zero at midnight automatically which I wasn't sure I liked. Don't know why I felt that way, but it is a good thing now that I have used it. Gives me a 'clean' count every morning. In my jeans pocket or clipped to my shirt collar, seems to give an accurate count. I recommend this pedometer.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: HJ-112 Pocket Pedometer
customer_reviews.text: I am male, 68 yeras old. This is the first pedometer I have ever owned. I researched many different ones and finaly decided on this. Advertisement, looks and price were the determineing factors. I have used it 3 weeks and it has lived up to all the claims. It is easy to read and work the functions, I dropped it and kicked it accidently and it suffered no ill effects so I guess it is durable. I wish there was more information about walking in the instructions ie: average steps in a normal day, how much to walk to lose weight and other info on the benefits of walking. I would definely reccommend this Pedometer.
customer_reviews.author: Harold E. Timmons

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pedometer. I am techno challenged & with the help of the manual I had no problem programing this pedometer. I love that it gives me the distance I have walked & the calories I have burned. I have walked with this in my purse & my pocket & it still kept track of my steps. I did follow the suggestion of a fellow reviewer & used the alligator clip as a back up to keep the pedometer attached. It has saved me from dropping it more than once. I have found my self more motivated to up my steps everyday. It has been a great tool towards my health & weight loss goals.
customer_reviews.author: C. Futch

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate but better than others.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these, one for myself and one for my husband. For some reason my husband wasn't getting as many steps in as I was so one day I wore both of them and his did read about 500 steps less than mine did at the end of the day. One of the reasons I bought this was because of the extra clip that hooks to your pants. Good thing I did because it has come off several times but the extra clip has kept it from completely coming off. If you want something accurate this one isn't it but it will give you a good idea of how many steps your walking a day.
customer_reviews.author: StitchinGal

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Best
customer_reviews.text: I had a number of step counters. I hated wearing them on my belt - I gave up pocket protectors years ago. But if I put them in my pocket, they always reset. Indeed, many of them would reset on my belt due to my arm brushing against them. The Omron is a miracle. It's made to be put in your pocket. I have tested it by waling 100 paces with it in my pocket and it is inevitable accurate. It's not so large as to be annoying - it's about the size of a car key fob. And it has loads of extra features. This is clearly the best pedometer out there and well worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: N. Foss

customer_reviews.title: The best pedometer out on the market
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several pedometers over the past few years with the hope that they live up to what the manufactor says it can do. Another person told me about this pedometer that keeps accurate steps whether it is in your pocket or fastened to your belt. I thought by word of mouth is better advertising then what the manufactor has been putting on the packaging, so I purchased the Omron HJ pedometer and I too am a believer in this pedometer as being accurate and one of the best pedometers out on the market. I love the different modes, and the easiness in working it.,
customer_reviews.author: JoJo G.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and am very happy I purchased this Pedometer. I love the functionality of being able to compare 7 days of workouts. VERY easy to use. Tracks: Miles, Steps, Aerobic Steps, Aerobic Minutes, and Calories. LOL...Was shocked to learn how few calories are burned in 45 minutes of exercise with slightly over 4300 aerobic steps! BUY IT! You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: M.R.

customer_reviews.title: Best Pedometer Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific little pedometer with many merits. The most important is that one can simply slip it in a pocket where it functions brilliantly. I have lost every other pedometer I have ever owned because, without fail, they eventually slipped off my belt during a hike. This one is also extremely accurate and has many features which I needn't repeat here. And when it came time to change the battery, I realized I had forgotten how to reset it and didn't have the manual. I went to Omron's website, downloaded the manual, and reset it all in about a five minute span of time. This is definitely the pedometer to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Gunnyvil

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using this pedometer for about 4 days so far, but it is working perfectly. It seems to be very accurate when walking. I also used it while on my exercise bike yesterday and it seemed to be in the ballpark of my estimate of the number of "steps" (pedal turns) that I estimated. The clip that comes with it holds it very securely, though I usually don't use it. My only complaint is that you can't turn off the display, but I only want to do that to preserve battery life. I suppose, though, that wouldn't make much of a difference since it is basically a watch-type screen.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mayes

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly was it is supposed to do and it is easy to use. I must warn that the back clip just not grip as much as I would like, but the designers included a second clip that prevents your meter from flying off. It comes in handy when moving quickly. I love that it automatically resets and has a seven memory. Best of all the step count is pretty accurate for walking. I have not tested it for running, but it is probably just as accurate if you make the numerical adjustments in stride length. I would recommend this pedometer to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Noloty O

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it will do- great for making me want to walk more
customer_reviews.text: Although this product won't count every little step that you take (It takes about 3-4 seconds of walking to register), it's great for keeping track of your overall steps per day. I love the memory function- if I've had too many "low number" days in a row, I know I've got to get moving. At first I had trouble with the pedometer falling off. Now I clip it to my pocket or to my belt BACKWARDS. (I hook it onto my pants pocket in such a way that if it falls off it falls into my pocket.) The accuracy is just as good and I haven't had to re-trace my steps to find it.
customer_reviews.author: TalkShop99

customer_reviews.title: When you follow the instructions and program it for your ...
customer_reviews.text: When you follow the instructions and program it for your normal strideit is highly accurate! I purchased two of them,one for each of my son, and now I'm going to buy two more, one each for my wife and I. They seem to be well constructed as both my boys have dropped her several times on to this man is there walking or runninThey seem to be well constructed as both my boys have dropped their's several times on the cement or roadway while walking or running with no adverse effects! They had been used long enough now to consider them a four or five star purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Incarnato

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, easy to use, good sturdy clip
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought another pedometer with a small, weak belt clip that was just about useless. The clip on this Omron is strong and stays on. But, if for some reason it would slip the "just in case" clip would keep the pedometer from coming off completely. I love the fact that the pedometer automatically zeros itself out at midnight, ready for another day of counting steps. However it keeps your previous days' steps in memory which is a nice feature. I really like this pedometer!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy H.

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I like this item. The only problem I had was operating the clip. Luckily I found the answer on the message boards here (bend the clip backwards and the clip will open). Easy set up (less than 5 minutes) no problems, hasn't reset itself, lovin the 7 day memory! I have owned this brand of pedometer for about 3 years (or more) now. I am on my 5th one. (apparently you should not jump in the pool without taking it off) LOL. I had the computer software one but really didn't take the time to plug it in and keep track of data. Why 5 in 3 years? Me not the product. I tend to lose items quite frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to figure out the stride length first!
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy pedometer that seems to work pretty accurately once the stride length is correctly measured. It's a bit sensitive, but not overly so. I found it's best to carry in a pocket or clipped on, as there's too much jiggling in a purse. I doubt it's totally accurate as to number, but keeping track of daily steps gives an incentive to increase the number daily - which is the whole point of a pedometer. Highly recommend using the tether to avoid dropping it.
customer_reviews.author: J Quinlan

customer_reviews.title: Handy Pedometer!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this little pedometer for a few weeks now and fine it fairly accurate (the hard part is getting your stride lenght right). It certainly lets you know when you have been sluffing-off! I also like the fact that it has a "safety" line on it that clips to your pocket or waist so if the pedometer gets knocked off your waistband you don't lose it. Of course, you can also carry it in your pocket, since it doesn't have to be "right-side-up" to function. I'd recommend everyone carry one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Desert Dogs2

customer_reviews.title: great little machine
customer_reviews.text: This pedometer is terrific. It took virtually no set up, so it was easy to get started. It records your steps, as it should, along with aerobic steps and other things. As advertised, you have options as to where/how to carry it. If you wear waistbands, belts, and pockets, you've got it made in the shade. But if you lean toward little summer dresses, no problem. It is small enough to slip into your bra & it works just fine there. I've even worn it inside the top of a ballet leotard. Convenient & it works. What more can you ask?
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Pedometer!
customer_reviews.text: After reading a lot of reviews on this pedometer, we purchased 2 of them. We are very happy with them. It seems to perform just as stated. It seems to be quite accurate. We now can tell how much more walking we need to obtain the suggested 10,000 steps per day. We make sure that we put the unit on first thing in the morning and don't take it off until bed time. A great product for anyone concerned with their health. The price is very reasonable for a product like this. And Omron's reputation is something you can depend on. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Zander

customer_reviews.title: Just what I need!
customer_reviews.text: What I really like is that this pedometer can be worn in your pocket, this is much more comfortable than wearing it on your waist and feeling it everytime you lean over. I programmed it and started wearing it immediately. The only problem I have, and I've had this same problem with other pedometers, is that when step-walking to a video (walking in place) it's not accurate. It does seem to be accurate when walking in a normal fashion though. If not for that I would have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easily consealable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this when I decided to start exercising. It keeps track of every step that I take and makes me accountable for getting off my butt to take the appropriate number of steps a day. It is great quality. I just put it in my pocket and go. I can hardly tell that it is there. Unlike some pedometer, it does NOT make a clicking sound every step you take. Everyone doesn't need to know that you have this in your pocket. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gosslady

customer_reviews.title: Dad loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Dad almost 3 years ago and he's still using it daily - and loves it. This little gadget is a charm, it functions both as a pedometer and digital pocket watch, the belt clip and loop lanyard keeps it secure to your belt or outer layer of clothing. You can adjust it to your individual body weight, height, and foot pace length. it measures distance covered in steps, miles, or kilometers. It also gives the total calories you consumed, which is great for workout purposes. For the price, highly recommended product.
customer_reviews.author: Sinbad

customer_reviews.title: More "generous" in counting steps
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier version of this pedometer, and loved it. When it went lost, I bought the HJ-112. Then I found the other one (also an HJ-112, but it had 4 buttons instead of three) and began carrying both in my pockets for a few days. The newer model seemed to count the same number of steps when I was out for a long walk, but it counted MORE steps when I was just ambling around the house. I suspect the newer model is doing a better job of counting actual steps, even if they don't burn as many calories as steps taken as part of a concerted walk.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Finally!  A pedometer that works!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 5 pedometers to date not including the little 'free' ones that sometimes accompany a book. They were all hard to set up, none were accurate, and they all 'skipped' or 'missed' and sometimes after a good long walk you would have no reading at all! I was disappointed in all brands and it didn't matter how much money was spent. This Omron is by far the best, easiest to set up and use, and VERY accurate! I love it and hardly notice it on my waist. Thank you for making something that works and is WELL worth the small dollar amount spent.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Burch

customer_reviews.title: Great Motivator!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really thrilled with this pedometer. It works better than any I've ever used, and it doesn't need to be clipped to your waistband...I just put it in my pocket and go. Another great feature is the "aerobic steps" count. It was enlightening to see that even though I'd do the 10,000 steps thing in a normal workday, I still wasn't getting ANY aerobic movement...that is, over 10 minutes continuous movement. The automatic reset (at midnight each day) and 7 day memory are also great. Sure, you can get cheaper pedometers, but this is worth the extra bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Opinionated

customer_reviews.title: great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. I have tried several other cheaper pedometers in the past. They were very inaccurate and did not last very long. I have had this product for over a month and my husband was so impressed that he ordered his own. It works great in a pocket, you don't have to worry with clips etc. I have also just carried it in my purse-- I do not think it is as accurate that way, but it still gives me a great idea of how much I have walked if I do not have a pocket to put it in. I highly encourage you to purchase this product if you are thinking about it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Best pedometer I have owned!!!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I have had every cheap pedometer known to man. The clips break easily, the numbers start fading, etc. This pedometer is great. I have worn it clipped onto my pants in and out and it stays on. It also works greatly in my pocket. I am impressed with the 7 day tracking. I can look back up to a week and see how many steps I have walked. I would recommend this pedometer to anyone who is tired of the cheap ones that break all the time. Spend a few more bucks and get your money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Cleveland Rocks

customer_reviews.title: Part (battery) missing from packaging
customer_reviews.text: After doing research on the pedometer that would work best for what i needed the Omron HJ-112 was ordered. My package arrived today so it was opened and was all ready to go testing it out only to find that the battery that was supposed to be included with the product was NOT included and it is one of the speciality batteries so will have to make a trip to try to find one before the unit can be tested out. Just hate it when things that are supposed to be included aren't and the battery will cost me an additional $5.00 - bummer !!!!
customer_reviews.author: JCD

customer_reviews.title: Good Gift for a walker/jogger
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom as a gift. She walks quite a bit every day. She really, really likes this pedometer. She had used other ones previously that turned out to not be very accurate & would break. This one is still working great after a couple months, & is user friendly. It clips on securely & seems to be very accurate whether it's clipped onto you or lying in your purse. It also has a clock on it, which is very convenient. This pedometer seemed to be the best value after looking at many different models. Good brand too.
customer_reviews.author: MichelleU

customer_reviews.title: Very good pedometer
customer_reviews.text: After I found out that I had diabetes, my doctor told me that I needed to start walking every day in addition to taking my medication and that it would be good to walk at least 10,000 steps a day. I decided to purchase a pedometer and after doing a lot of research I decided on this one. This pedometer works really well and is well made. Whether you walk for enjoyment or because your doctor tells you that you need to and you need or want a pedometer, I recommend this one highly.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We had a contest going on at work and the pedometers we got were very cheap and inaccurate. I wanted a nice pedometer without spending a lot of money. I read earlier reviews on this and most were excellent. It's great to be able to put it in your pocket or clip it on. Mine even held on throughout a Zumba class. It doesn't have a ton of bells and whistles but I didn't really want all that. It keeps track 7 days out and automatically resets each night. It's not overly sensitive and once I got my stride down right-it has been very accurate. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: MelCrab

customer_reviews.title: Great Ped
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these for 10 years and it is still going even though the finish is worn off. I used to have to replace one every 3 months, but this one is great. The screw will no longer hold the battery cover on so I use scotch tape. It still does what it has done for 10 years and most of the time, in my pocket, all day, day in and day out. I was surprised how much this ped has gone up after 10 years. I think the HJ 113 would perform in a similar manner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally, one that works
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many pedometers and each time they would break, wouldn't stay clipped on or the battery would run out faster than what was stated. This pedometer is GREAT! It not only gives you your step count but your calories and aerobic steps. It is easy to clip on and it stays on. It even resets it self. No more resetting. The best part about the pedometer is that you can put it in a pocket or purse and it accurately counts those steps. Wow! Stop looking at any other pedometers, trust me. Save your money. Purchase this pedometer, you will be happy!
customer_reviews.author: At Peace

customer_reviews.title: Wish this was waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason we bought another pedometer was because the last two went through the washing machine. Which on a side note after two washes the numbers started fading and after the third wash it completely died. Anyway, this was a birthday present, and she still loves this model. As you may have deduced from the first sentence this the third pedometer of the same model I have purchased. It is easy to set up and a basic pedometer. The display is clear and easy to read. If this one dies in the wash I will probably buy the same model. Maybe they can develop a waterproof one!
customer_reviews.author: Angela J. Cooey

customer_reviews.title: Best pedometer I've had or heard of
customer_reviews.text: Got this very inexpensively as an Amazon "deal of the day" and it is very impressive. The first few days, I did a number of counting steps checks and they were all right on the money. Further, this one uses a technology that is different from and far more accurate than my previous pendulum-based pedometers. The calorie-counter and fat-burned displays are a plus, as is the distinction between aerobic steps and non-aerobic. The fact that it automatically saves your last seven days of data is a welcomed feature. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Yavelow

customer_reviews.title: Pedometer. A helping guide for exercise
customer_reviews.text: THe pedometer has great reviews and I don't disagree B U T the clip is totally worthless and the manufacturer is not willing to do anything to assist . I asked if the clip might be a faulty item and they might replace it with another that might not be faulty. "It's not our policy to do that." Not so good customer service and as good as the unit is what good is it if ot won't stay put? Just my opinion but you asked for it
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Rothschild

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: The device was easy to set up. Seems to be quite accurate. We like it very much!
customer_reviews.author: Hugh

customer_reviews.title: Get moving - keep track
customer_reviews.text: I have had this pedometer for more than a month. The great thing about this one is that it not only tracks your steps but differentiates between just regular steps and aerobic steps. It calculates distance walked all day and calories burned. It also resets itself every night at midnight. The set up is simple. This is actually my second - I washed the first one in the washing machine. It did not survive. I am compelled to move more each day when I wear the pedometer - the goal is 10,000 steps - around 3 miles.
customer_reviews.author: dissreader

customer_reviews.title: Getting my 10,000 steps a day in!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is still on his first one that he has had for 2 yrs. but I am on my 3rd one in 4 yrs. (I lost one (forgot to clip it) and have worn out one.) I have tried 2 other pedometers by other manufacturers thinking I wanted something flatter snf quicker BUT returned them promptly. The Omron HJ-112 is the most accurate and user friendly and also, you can see youir steps easily with the large and dark number display. Also, it was shipped to my home in 2 days!!! Great product!. .
customer_reviews.author: Karen Szemenciak

customer_reviews.title: I use it, but is NOT what I ordered!
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this Item there was a Picture posted with the Pedometer showing 4 buttons, one was to RESET it by hand, so you don't have to wait till midnight for the Item to do it automatically, and that's the model I wanted and ordered.....well, guess what? They send me the Pedometer that every one gets, with the three buttons, since I wasn't aware of it and had already cut the plastic casing to get to the unit, I couldn't send it back, so I'm Stuck with it! I will never order from this seller again!
customer_reviews.author: Wolfee1

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, but gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I love this inexpensive pedometer! I had a garmin and just had way too much info to know before even operating it. I wanted simple and accurate, and got both with the omron!! I even placed a call to customer service with a few quick questions, and had the nicest person giving me the answers. To me customer service has to be as important as the product. I highly recommend this if you are just wanting life simplified and happy with a perfect little pedometer.
customer_reviews.author: Janet E. Cullen

customer_reviews.title: I love my pedometer!
customer_reviews.text: I just got into fitness walking and a pedometer is a must to keep track of my distance and for motivation purposes. I have absolutely NO complaints in the accuracy of this product! I love that it counts calories and you can go back 7 days of information if you haven't written it down. My only complaint is there's no power button... How long do the batteries generally last? You're just suppose to use it until the battery dies... Are these batteries easy/cheap to buy?
customer_reviews.author: AP123

customer_reviews.title: A Pedometer only My Wife Would Like
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife for Christmas after she had tried out other pedometers that see had problems with. She really likes this pedometer as she can leave it in her pocket and the buttons are recessed enough that they don't get pushed by accident during the day while she is at work. She also likes that it can auto reset every day so she doesn't have to do anything but slip it into her pocket and she always has a new count of her steps each and every day.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mineart

customer_reviews.title: Best pedometer I have ever bought!
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled to finally find a pedometer that doesn't have to be attached to your waistband. (This pedometer can be carried in your pocket.) I have owned several and inevitably have lost them, and never found them very comfortable to wear. The "memory" feature is an added bonus making it easy to keep track of your progress and it's a great motivator. I would highly recommend this pedometer to anyone who has an interest in using one. If you have had less then great experiences with others, I suspect like me you will love this one.
customer_reviews.author: Paula S. in CT

customer_reviews.title: Pedometer with nice features
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set. Keeps track of steps, distance and calories burned. Resets itself to 0 at midnight. I especially like how it keeps the last 7 days in memory. Good motivational tool. It is small and light, easy to always have in your pocket. I have used every day for last 8 weeks. I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because the clear plastic is all scratched up from keys or coins in my pocket. Did not use the holder with clip (would have prevented the scratches).
customer_reviews.author: jcmiller

customer_reviews.title: The best pedometer
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many different pedometers over the years. Finally bought an Omron several years ago at the recommendation of a surgeon friend and loved it. It is very accurate. I accidently dropped the original one in a swimming pool and when I couldn't find this brand/model in my local sporting goods and department stores I once again tried different types and brands, including the wrist "watch" kind that montiors heart rate, etc. Ended up taking them all back when I found the Omron online. The Omron is simply the best pedometer I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: D. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: This was a slightly different model than I have worn for the past 2 years, and at first, I wasn't sure about the slightly bulkier detachable clip holder. (The other one just had a spring-loaded clip on the back.) Once I got it on, though, I liked the larger display and was pleased to learn that this model can be placed in your pocket, or inside a purse, if needed, and it still appears to count steps accurately. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SS Teacher

product_meta.title: Omron HJ-112 Digital Pocket Pedometer
product_meta.description:
AMAZON.COM


PRODUCT DESCRIPTION: OMRON HJ-112 PEDOMETER
 No matter where you're going, make every step count with the HJ-112 Pedometer. Using Omron 2D smart sensor technology, this dual-axis pedometer tracks steps accurately, whether it's in your pocket, on your belt, or clipped to your bag.

WHEN YOU KNOW YOUR NUMBERS, YOU'LL GROW YOUR NUMBERS
 You'd be surprised by how many steps you already take each day. A few hundred walking to the bus, a couple thousand going a few blocks down for lunch, and with an Omron Pedometer, you'll know just how many steps you're taking and begin looking for ways to see that number get bigger every day.

EVERY STEP COUNTS
 Omron Pedometers use smart sensor technology rather than the standard pendulum system to get a more accurate reading. Many Omron Pedometers, including the HJ-112, can be programmed to your personal stride length to provide you with an even more accurate count.

THE OMRON HJ-112 PEDOMETER OFFERS:
Omron Dual-Axis Technology--Counts steps accurately and quietly, whether positioned vertically or horizontally.

Automatic Reset--Start with a clean slate each day to track your steps more accurately.

Weekly Log--Store up to seven days of information in memory; resets to zero at midnight, so you're ready to go every morning.

Six Tracking Modes--Track steps, aerobic steps, time, distance, calories, and fat grams burned.

Tracking for Two Kinds of Steps--The HJ-112 tracks both regular and brisk steps separately.

THE OMRON HJ-112 PEDOMETER FEATURES:
Omron HJ-112 Pedometer +View LargerOmron HJ-112 Pedometer Features +View LargerCompare full line of Omron Pedometers +View LargerA FEW STEPS TOWARD A HEALTHIER LIFE
 Walking is a great way to stay healthy. In fact, walking 10,000 steps a day is widely recommended by health and fitness professionals. And when you track your steps with a pedometer, like the Omron HJ-112, studies show you're likely to increase your total number of steps a day by about 2,000, or 1 mile.*

GETTING STARTED
Warm Up First--Before your walk, stretch (arm circles, hip circles, and leg lifts) to get your blood flowing and reduce the risk of injury.

Use a Pedometer--Omron Pedometers are the partners you can count on when you want to accurately track your daily routine and help you reach your recommended 10,000 daily steps.

Set Goals--Begin slowly and work your way up. By setting goals you'll push yourself farther and achieve more.

Mix It Up--Add variety to your routine by changing pace, walking uphill, or just changing your route.

Add Resistance--Include some upper-body exercises as you walk, such as arm reaches or carrying water bottles in each hand to increase your calorie burn.

 *JAMA. 2007; 298 190:2296-2304

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
 Omron HJ-112 Pedometer, lithium battery, holder, strap and clip, and instruction manual.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Whether you're taking a walk or taking steps to meet your fitness goals, you'll love how Omron's HJ-112 Dual-Axis Pocket Pedometer easily and accurately tracks your progress. The pedometer features advanced 2D Smart Sensor Technology, which means you can use it horizontally or vertically. For added convenience, you can carry the HJ-112 in your pocket or secure it to your bag or belt loop with the included clip.




The HJ-112 measures steps, aerobic steps, time, and distance quietly and accurately. 
View larger.HJ-112 Pocket Pedometer
At a Glance:
 * Can be used horizontally or vertically
 * Quiet and accurate
 * Measures steps, aerobic steps, time, and distance
 * Calculates calories and fat grams burned
 * Stores seven days of information
 * Resets automatically at midnight
 * Large display

Pocket Pedometer with Smart Sense Technology
Instead of using a simple pendulum mechanism (the clicking device you hear on most pedometers), this Omron pedometer uses Smart Sense Technology with advanced acceleration sensors. These sensors detect exactly when you are taking a step and filter out non-walking movements, ensuring your count is accurate.Versatile Attachment Options
The HJ-112 comes with a convenient clip, and it is clinically validated for use in a pocket, purse, bag, or on the hip. For further ease of use, 2D Smart Sensor Technology allows you to position the pedometer horizontally or vertically.




2D Smart Sensor Technology allows you to use the HJ-112 both horizontally and vertically. Accurate Calculations Displayed on a Large Screen
While you walk, the HJ-112 quietly and accurately measures steps, aerobic steps, time, and distance. It also calculates calories and fat grams burned.The large screen separately displays aerobic steps and minutes, which the pedometer calculates after 10 minutes of continuous walking at more than 60 steps per minute.

The HJ-112 counts steps with 5 percent accuracy.

What's in the Box
Omron HJ-112 Digital Pocket Pedometer with holder, strap, clip, lithium battery, screwdriver, and instruction manual.
